tweets.text: Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

Enough is enough & this town is going to keep shouting to the highest authorities in the country until the poison is stopped! Thank you to the council for standing up for the town @SimonTagg CAP IT OFF! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe https://t.co/u8mbXPtLLI

Amazed that the @EnvAgency aren‚Äôt investigating the blue powder. What are the risks to public health if it‚Äôs Blue Billy as expected & is wafting over the homes & gardens of local people @PHE_EoEngland @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/iHp3wab9mk

For those concerned about the risk to the chalk aquifer  caused by HS2 tunnelling we need access to see the details the environmental approval application lodged with the @EnvAgency recently. The contact email would be enquiries@environment-agency.gov.uk.

We‚Äôve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we‚Äôve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

tweets.text: @Krisp06 @Chilternstreams @EnvAgency apparently no, they discounted this when the @RiverChess pointed out at a meeting in April 2019 that this would be on average 200 tankers per day more than 8 deliveries per hour. HS2 project management are a complete joke.

@ilkleyIain @WildTroutTrust @YorkshireWater @h_r_marshall @WoodlandTrust @aireriverstrust @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireiCASP @LeedsFAS @PeteTurnerEA @AireCatchment @SkiptonAngling @SandTCUKYorks @ThorpeTrees Two different views, both valid. I was meaning shade for keeping water cool, so important on these exposed, small, shallow tribs. Multi ecosystem goods & services to farm as well. Character limit eh?
